1.body: Ignite your senses with an Arabesque feast at La Fez. Try their almond tart - a fruity, nutty and creamy all rolled into one, topped with Chantilly cream and fresh figs.
1.name: La Fez Cafe & Bakery

2.body: Located on level 2 of The Straits Teppanyaki, Rumi The Poets Cup is best known for their artisanal drinks accompanied by poetry notes for an added touch. Quench your thirst with Rumi's masterfully crafted Artisanal Coffee and mocktail selection. They have been a local favourite for years.
2.name: Rumi The Poets Cup Rooftop Bar

3.body: Boba fans, get a taste of Singapore with Milk's Ice Kacang Bubble Tea. They also offer crispy, fluffy honeycomb Waffles – a delightful dessert for any sweet-tooth.
3.description: Muslim-owned cafe offering delectable bubble tea and waffles
3.name: Milk Singapore

4.body: Some say they have one of the best Halal Buttermilk Waffles in town. Pair it with one of their signature gelato and you might rethink sharing this dessert.
4.description: Muslim-owned cafe offering waffles, gelato and beverages
4.name: 100labs

5.body: Indian-Muslim restaurant known for their nasi biryani and murtabak.
5.description: Indian-Muslim restaurant known for their nasi biryani and murtabak.
5.name: Al Tasneem

6.body: Muslim-owned Chinese eatery serving up Sichuan cuisine.
6.description: Muslim-owned Chinese eatery serving up Sichuan cuisine.
6.name: Le Fuse Cafe

7.body: The snaking lines speak volumes. This bakery is loved by locals, serving up handcrafted, artisanal baked goods like their Double Baked Almond Croissant.
7.description: Muslim-owned bakery with an emphasis on flavour and quality ingredients
7.name: Mother Dough Bakery

8.body: A Muslim-owned restaurant ranked #1 for Italian, Pizza and Halal cuisine on TripAdvisor.
8.description: A Muslim-owned restaurant ranked #1 for Italian, Pizza and Halal cuisine on TripAdvisor.
8.name: Positano

9.body: Indian Muslim restaurant famous for its Soup Tulang (bone marrow soup).
9.description: Indian Muslim restaurant famous for its Soup Tulang (bone marrow soup).
9.name: M.A Deen Biasa

10.body: A 100% Muslim-owned resto that serves delicious halal Western food and really good coffee.
10.description: A 100% Muslim-owned resto that serves delicious halal Western food and really good coffee.
10.name: Royz Et Vous

11.body: A heritage South-Indian Muslim restaurant that's famous for its biryani and murtabak.
11.description: A heritage South-Indian Muslim restaurant that's famous for its biryani and murtabak.
11.name: Zam Zam

12.body: This humble Muslim-run bakery specialises in decadent, halal-certified sliced cakes, kuehs and cupcakes.
12.description: This humble Muslim-run bakery specialises in decadent, halal-certified sliced cakes, kuehs and cupcakes.
12.name: Julie Bakes

13.body: Muslim-owned dessert store that uses 100% halal-certified ingredients in their soft serve and toppings.
13.description: Muslim-owned dessert store that uses 100% halal-certified ingredients in their soft serve and toppings.
13.name: Moosh Softserve

14.body: Muslim-owned dessert cafe serving Hong Kong egglets with unique ice cream flavours.
14.description: Muslim-owned dessert cafe serving Hong Kong egglets with unique ice cream flavours.
14.name: Lickety Ice Cream & Waffles

15.body: Yi Zun Noodle has been described by local Masterchef SG season 1 finalist and foodie, Syamsydar Ani as "a place (she) absolutely (loves). Other than their renowned hand-pulled beef noodles, their mutton skewers are a must-try, they do it really well. (She) also (loves) how so many authentic Halal Chinese food places have been making a name for themselves in the Singapore food scene in recent years."
15.description: Singapore's first ever muslim-owned restaurant that specialises in Chinese hand-pulled noodles and authentic Xinjiang Cuisine
15.name: Yi Zun Noodle

16.body: A 110-year-old Southern Indian-Muslim restaurant that is famous for its murtabak, a flatbread with meat fillings.
16.description: A 110-year-old Southern Indian-Muslim restaurant that is famous for its murtabak, a flatbread with meat fillings.
16.name: Victory Restaurant

17.body: An uncommon sight in the Telok Ayer stretch, Royz Et Vous remains a hit amongst local Muslims. While their menu features pasta, pizza and a particularly scrumptious herb-encrusted salmon, the true revelation is their brazen tenderloin. Stop by and grab a cup of their Mint Mocha and Red Velvet Latte while you are at it.
17.description: An uncommon sight in the Telok Ayer stretch, Royz Et Vous remains a hit amongst local Muslims.
17.name: Royz Et Vous

18.body:
An authentic wagyu beef experience awaits at WakuWaku Yakiniku. Specialising in Japanese Yakiniku BBQ, this Muslim-owned restaurant is Singapore’s first halal yakiniku and they even have a Japanese chef on board to deliver the same dining experience from his home country!

If you’re dining with your loved ones, order one of their famous beef platters that consist of different cuts of meats. You’ll also be pleased to know that they serve jo-karubi (boneless short rib) that is one of the most popular wagyu cuts. For foodies who are feeling adventurous, try the special delicacy called Gyutan, a Japanese dish that’s made from grilled beef tongue.
18.description: WakuWaku Yakiniku is a Muslim-owned restaurant that serves Japanese yakiniku BBQ. With a Japanese chef on board, feast on delicacies like beef tongue, jo-karubi (boneless short rib), grilled teriyaki salmon, and more.
18.name: WakuWaku Yakiniku

19.body:
Burgers will always have a special place in our hearts, and the same can be said with Fatpapas, a Muslim-owned restaurant that serves up delicious burgers, ribs and shakes. Founded by Bernie and Haikel, they were inspired to create a halal version of Fat Boys, their sister company with a build-your-own-burger menu, and today, Muslim diners can enjoy the same yummy burger too!

Their specialty homemade burgers are made using Chilled Australian chuck tender, and you can taste them in burgers like Shroom Melt, Black Peppercorn Burger, and more. Otherwise, you can enjoy finger-lickin main courses such as BBQ Beef Ribs and Country Fried Steak. Don’t forget to try their Ten Dollar Milkshakes with flavours like chocolate, strawberry, and vanilla.
19.description: Fatpapas is a Muslim-owned restaurant that serves up delicious burgers, ribs and shakes. Their must-try dishes include Shroom Melt burger, Country Fried Steak, and Ten Dollar Milkshakes.
19.name: Fatpapas
